summary: The Department of Veteran Affairs provides health care services to more than six million veterans, but many live in areas with limited access to care. In FY 2019, VA began designating facilities as "underserved" if the facility couldn't meet demands for care. These facilities identified ways to improve access, such as increasing telehealth. Officials at these facilities shared mixed responses about VA's efforts. Some said...
title: VA Health Care: The Medically Underserved Facilities Initiative
